name: Barbell Walking Lunges
how_to_perform:
1. Hold a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart and your arms fully extended.
2. Take a large step forward with one foot, keeping the other foot behind you.

3. Begin walking forward while maintaining a lunging position. Lower your body down until your back knee is almost touching the ground and your front thigh is parallel to the ground.

4. Push through your front heel to extend your body back up to the starting position.
5. Repeat with the opposite leg by taking a large step forward again, keeping one foot behind you.

6. Continue walking forward in this manner for the desired number of steps or repetitions.
short_summary: Barbell Walking Lunges are an exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes while providing cardiovascular benefits.
